title.narrative: Parliamentarians for Global Action Core Support 2019-2021

description.narrative: Parliamentarians for Global Action (PGA) is a non-governmental, multi-party, international network of legislators mobilizing parliamentarians in all regions of the world to advocate for human rights and rule of law, democracy, human security, inclusion and gender equality. Sida provides core support to PGA's strategic plan 2019-2021, which is aimed at contributing to PGA’s vision of a rules-based international order for a more equitable, safe and democratic world through its three programs as below. All programmes and actions of PGA are organized into results-oriented campaigns and PGA works with the following eight campaigns during the period 2019-2021 within each of the three programs: - Core campaign on Democratic Renewal and Human Rights 1) International Law and Human Rights - Campaign of the Universality and Effectiveness of the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court (ICC) system -Campaign for the Abolition of the Death Penalty (ADP) -Campaign for the Protection of the Oceans and Implementation of SDG 14 2) Gender, Equality and Inclusion -Campaign on Ending Child, Early and Forced Marriage (CEFM) -Campaign against Discrimination based on Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity (SOGI 3) International Peace and Security - Campaign to Address the Illicit Trade in Small Arms and Light Weapons (SALW) and Improved Regulation of the International Arms Trade to Prevent Human Rights Abuses - Campaign for Universality and Implementation of the Biological and Toxin Weapons Convention (BWC) and Implementation of UN Security Council Resolution 1540 (2004)

Insatsen avser ett kärnstöd till Parliamentarians for Global Action (PGA) om totalt 9 MNSEK för att implementera sin strategiska plan "Mobilizing Legislators as Champions for Human Rights, Democracy and Peace" under perioden 2019-2021.
Insatsen syftar till att mobilisera parlamentsledamöter att bidra till en internationell ordning baserad på internationella regelverk för en mer rättvis, säker och demokratisk värld. Detta genom arbete mot 8 målområden:
- Universalitet och effektivitet av Romstadgan av den internationella brottmålsdomstolen (ICC) och dess system - Universalitet och implementering av konventionen om biologiska och kemiska vapen (BWC) samt implementering av FN's säkerhetsrådsresolution 1540 (2004) - Förhindra den olagliga handeln med lätta vapen (SALW) samt förbättrad reglering av internationell vapenhandel för att förhindra övergrepp på mänskliga rättigheter - Stoppa barn- och tidiga tvingande äktenskap - Stoppa diskriminering på basis av sexuell orientering och genus identitet - Stoppa dödsstraffen - Skydd av haven och implementering av SDG 14 - Säkerställa att demokratiska normer, institutioner och civilt och politiskt utrymme, inklusive lagstiftares grundläggande rättigheter, är skyddade och uppehållna
PGA's totala organisationsbudget för projektperioden 2019-2021 är 62 MNSEK, av vilken PGA efterfrågar 9 MNSEK (14,5%) från Sida i kärnstöd. Den återstående delen planeras att täckas av medel från Danmark, Kanada, Nederländerna, Estland, Schweiz, Liechtenstein (Global Equality Fund), mellanstatliga organisationer som UNSCAR och EU kommissionen samt stiftelser och fonder så som Stewart R Mott Foundation, Arcus Foundation, CRDF Global, Oak Foundation, Open Society Foundations, Planethood Foundation, Raymond & Elizabeth Bloch Foundation och Sigrid Rausing Trust.

Parliamentarians for Global Action has applied to Sida for core funding of 9 million SEK to implement their strategic plan "Mobilizing Legislators as Champions for Human Rights, Democracy and Peace" during the period 2019-2021.
The intervention aims to moblize legislators to contribute to a rules based international order for a more equitable, safe and democratic world. PGA will work through campaigns focused at 8 overarching objectives:
- Universality and Effectiveness of the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court (ICC) system - Universality and Implementation of the Biological and Toxin Weapons Convention (BWC) and Implementation of UN Security Council Resolution 1540 (2004) - Addressing the Illicit Trade in Small Arms and Light Weapons (SALW) and Improved Regulation of the International Arms Trade to Prevent Human Rights Abuses - Ending Child, Early and Forced Marriage (CEFM) - Ending Discrimination based on Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity (SOGI) - Abolition of the Death Penalty (ADP) - Protection of the Oceans and Implementation of SDG 14 (to conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources) - Democratic Renewal and Human Rights (in development)
The Global Parliamentary Campaign for Democratic Renewal and Human Rights, is a new Campaign intended to contribute directly to PGA’s vision by supporting the networking mechanism among all parliamentary associations and legislative caucuses.
The interventions total budget for the period 2019-2021 is estimated to 62 million SEK contributed by Institutional donors, Foundations and other Private entities.

tag.narrative: 14.4 - By 2020, effectively regulate harvesting and end overfishing, illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing and destructive fishing practices and implement science-based management plans, in order to restore fish stocks in the shortest time feasible, at least to levels that can produce maximum sustainable yield as determined by their biological characteristics.

14.4 - Senast 2020 införa en effektiv fångstreglering och stoppa överfiske, olagligt, orapporterat och oreglerat fiske liksom destruktiva fiskemetoder samt genomföra vetenskapligt baserade förvaltningsplaner i syfte att återställa fiskbestånden så snabbt som möjligt, åtminstone till de nivåer som kan producera maximalt hållbart uttag, fastställt utifrån deras biologiska egenskaper.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.8 - Broaden and strengthen the participation of developing countries in the institutions of global governance.
16.8 - Utvidga och stärka utvecklingsländernas deltagande i institutionerna för global styrning.
16.b - Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development.
16.b - Verka för och genomdriva icke-diskriminerande lagstiftning och politik för en hållbar utveckling.
5.3 - Avskaffa alla skadliga sedvänjor, såsom barnäktenskap, tidiga äktenskap och tvångsäktenskap samt kvinnlig könsstympning.
5.3 - Eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation.

title.narrative: Grant agreement between Sida and PGA 2019-2021

description.narrative: Sida has supported PGA since 1996 and with core funding since 2003. PGA works with individual parliamentarians in their national contexts and parliaments, and then leverages that capacity with international networking to support democracy, human rights and peace. This is done through educating, sensitizing, building the technical capacity and strengthening the will of parliamentarians to take ownership, take initiatives and take legislative action. During the 2019 reporting period the following main results can be noted: - Core campaign on Democratic Renewal and Human Rights PGA supported at-risk parliamentarians to protect democratic systems and prevent violations of the fundamental rights of parliamentarians and their constituents. This was done through joining or initating petitions, issuing statements or introducing resolutions in the Philippines, Venezuela, Argenting, Ecuador, Brazil, Cameroon, Sudan, the Maldives, Chile and Hong Kong. PGA also entered into new partnerships with the Democracy Decay and Renewal project as well as with the Raoul Wallenberg Centre for Human Rights. - Campaign of the Universality and Effectiveness of the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court (ICC) system Within this campaign PGA works for universal ratification and effective implementation of the Rome Statute of the ICC but also to combat anti-ICC backlash and enchance ICC's funcitioning. In 2019 PGA's work contributed to the accession of Kiribati to the Rome Statute and to several states taking significant steps towards implementation legislation and co-operation agreements, including CAR, Ecuador, the Gambia and Paraguay. In addition PGA organized events bringing different actors together in support of Ukraine's goal to ratify the Rome Statute in 2020. In addition, during 2019, PGA performed advocacy to support the Rome Statute in the UN and the European Parliament and rallied with NGO partners to support justice for victims of atrocities in the Rohingya crisis in Myanmar as well as in Sudan. PGA also works to combat anti-ICC backlash, in 2019 this included working against the visa restrictions on senior ICC officials by the US, and to enhance the ICC's functioning, including supporting a process of review and reform of the ICC. -Campaign for the Abolition of the Death Penalty (ADP) Within this campaign PGA works to abolish och to restrict the use of the dealth penalty, including through promoting the modification of national legal system as well as the ratification of the Second Optional Protocol to the International Covenant for Civil and Political Rights (OP2 ICCPR). In 2019 PGA supported efforts towards abolition, including through provision of technical assistance, in CAR, DRC, Mali and Indonesia and other initiatives included joint work with NGO partner ECPM resulting in a parliamentarian declaration at the 7th World Congress against the Death Penalty as well as launch of a network of Cameroonian parliamentarians against the death penalty. -Campaign for the Protection of the Oceans and Implementation of SDG 14 Within this campaign PGA works to end impunity for crimes committed and their related HR violations on the world's oceans, incuding within illegal, unregulated and unreported (IUU) fishing and sustainable small-scale fisheries. PFA seeks to rally political will and capacity for the national implementation of three international agreements, the so called "Three treaties to End Illegal Fishing". In 2019 PGA organised discussions and trainings on the three treaties and PGA members raised awareness through posting parliamentary questions in their national parliaments on the ratification and implementation status of the treaties. The role of parliamentarians in the ratifications of the treaties was also discussed at PGA's 2019 annual forum. -Campaign on Ending Child, Early and Forced Marriage (CEFM) PGA members supported PGA's social media campaign #MPs4GirlsRights and organised activities to mark the 2019 edition of the 16 days of activism against GBV. -Campaign against Discrimination based on Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity (SOGI) In 2019 PGA continued to work with civil society partners to sensitize and mobilize parliamentarians against discrimination based on SOGI, including through organizing events like "Promoting equality and inclusion for LGBTQI persons in the Pacific"; "Pacific youth and parliamentarians regional dialogue (resulting in a roadmap for action in the Commonwealth Pacific; and the "Global convening on the decriminalization of SOGI". In addition, the Praia Plan of Action to advance the human rights and inclusion of LGBTI people in the countries of the signatory parliamentarians, was adopted at the PGA 2019 annual forum. PGA also continued to raise awareness though translation of the PGA/UNDP handbook on the human rights for LGBTI people for parliamentarians into Portuguese. - Campaign to Address the Illicit Trade in Small Arms and Light Weapons (SALW) and to promote the Arms Trade Treaty (ATT) After many years of advocacy by PGA Palau and Botswana ratified the ATT and Botswana acceded to the ATT in 2019. Efforts to support to the process towards accession to the ATT was also undertaken by PGA in Colombia and Ecuador. In addition a regional carribean parliamentary workshop to promote the role of women legislator in addressing the illicit trade in SALW was organised in Trinidad and Tobago. - Campaign for Universality and Implementation of the Biological and Toxin Weapons Convention (BWC) and Implementation of UN Security Council Resolution 1540 (2004) In 2019 PGA organised regional workshops in the Carribbean and the Gambia on the BWC and the UNSCR 1540 resulting in a set of adopted action plans as well as improved understanding and awareness of the frameworks. PGA also supported a parliamentary delegation from Somalia to attend the 2019 Annual meeting of State Parties to the BWZ in Geneva. In addition PGA continued its advocacy and outreach on the two frameworks and in 2019 Tanzania ratified the BWC and Kiribati and South Sudan announced its plans to accede to the BWC. there was also significant progress towards accession tot he BWC in Kiribati and Tuvalu. CAR submitted its first report on implementation to the UNSCR 1540 Committe while PGA continued to work with members in the Gambia, Chad, Guinea and Mali to enourage submission of their first national report to the UNSCR 1540 committee.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
